headline: WATCH: Bengals Ja'Marr Chase surprises customers in drive-thru at Raising Canes
author: WLWT Digital Staff
sentences:
We love surprising our customers – and our amazing crewmembers, too – with unexpected visitors, and we’re grateful Chase dropped by to thank his fans for their support throughout the season.”
The rookie wide receiver was recently named the 2021 Pepsi Zero Sugar NFL Rookie of the Year.

Related video: Despite Super Bowl loss, Bengals fans remain loyal in wake of surprising post-season success
Chase said he's loved Canes ever since he was in college at LSU.

CINCINNATI —
One of the Bengals star receivers surprised hundreds of people this week when he passed out meals at the drive-thru of Raising Canes.
Many customers were surprised to see Chase serving up meals in the drive-thru on Wednesday at the location on Beechmont Avenue.
“I’ve been a Chase fan ever since his record-breaking days at LSU,” said Todd Graves, founder and co-CEO of Raising Cane’s.
Chase, who broke multiple Super Bowl era records was given a Rookie of the Year trophy from Pepsi.
“He’s one of the best receivers on the planet, and we’re proud to call him a Caniac.
College All-American to professional All-Pro; it doesn’t get much better than that.
Chase greeted fans at the counter as he passed out the meals.
